body: Marijuana is currently classified as a Schedule 1 drug in the Controlled Substances Act, a category reserved for drugs which have "no currently accepted medical use".  Marijuana has known medical uses and therefore should not be classified as a Schedule 1 substance.  The federal government should "accept" marijuana's known medical uses and remove it from the Schedule 1 list of drugs.
title: Remove Marijuana from the Schedule 1 list of drugs in the Controlled Substances Act
